comments:
I20061205-1200

- new workspace
- paste to Package Explorer:

package p;
import java.util.ArrayList;
public class Struct {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		ArrayList<Integer> list = new ArrayList<Integer>();
		list.add(1);
		list.add(2); //breakpoint
		list.add(3);
	}
}

- set breakpoint
- debug
- in Variables view, press 'Show Logical Structure'
- expand 'list' by clicking on +

=> child is:
    Name: Error
    Value: Exception occurred: Evaluation failed - thread not suspended..

=> clicking into the value field of the error child writes this to log:

Fixed NPE. I was unable to get the "error" to show up in the variables view. I saw it once, but could not reproduce. The time it did happend the NPE did not occurr (I had the fix in). The error occurrs if the type of the variable is not yet loaded in the target VM (and I'm not sure how that could be).
Fixed in JavaVariableCellModifier. Please verify, Mike.

I can consistently reproduce the "Exception occurred" by following the steps slowly (and not clicking elsewhere). I use a JDK 1.5.0_10-b02.

I filed bug 167259 for the "Exception occurred" and adapted the summary here.
